snippet: Mitt Romney tried to tie President Obama to President Jimmy Carter, a Democratic president considered by many to be weak on national security issues.
abstract: Presumptive Republican nominee Mitt Romney, in attempt to minimize Pres Obama's signature military accomplishment and burnish his own standing as a potential commander in chief, takes a swipe at Obama by implying that any president would have acted on the same intelligence to kill Osama bin Laden in Pakistan.

byline.contributor: Richard A. Oppel Jr. contributed reporting from New York, and Michael D. Shear from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney tried to tie President Obama to President Jimmy Carter, a Democratic president considered by many to be weak on national security issues.

headline.seo: Obama and Romney Spar Over Invoking of Bin Laden’s Raid
headline.main: Obama and Romney Spar Over Death of Bin Laden
headline.print_headline: Obama and Romney Spar Over Death of Bin Laden

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
